intro: Chasmia salzmannii, commonly known as the Salzmann's chasmia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, tubular florets that attract pollinators. Chasmia salzmannii is often found in coastal and inland regions, showcasing its adaptability to various environmental conditions.
